climbs.name: Hiro's Journey
climbs.fa: Adam Block and Luis Cisneros (Bolted by LC)

content.description:
Follows interesting corner movements with key holds up to a ledge, then up towards the high arÃªte, where delicate moves trending right take you to the top wall. Climb the excellent yellow rock to a slabby crux followed by a roof move high off the deck. 

 This route is long and thought provoking. It provides several good rests but otherwise fairly sustained and consistent (no moves are exceedingly harder than the others). You will journey through different styles of climbing as you move up. Be ready to think, bring your footwork game and have faith on the friction of rounded holds!

 ATTENTION: a 70mts rope is mandatory.
content.protection: 18 bolts. Use long draws and extensions to avoid rope drag!
content.location: Starts on the obvious corner with a shallow crack behind the Ledge of Solitude.

content.description:
Prominent amphitheater just right of the large buttress in the middle of the north face and which borders west of the Whippersnapper Wall. 

 There is a large ledge at the base of this wall (the Ledge of Solitude) that offers a great and comfortable hang out area with nice views of the valley. Shaded most of the day as any other wall on this ridge. It should be possible to chase either sun or shade according to the season by moving left or right in the amphitheater once more routes are developed. The rock here is of very good quality, with potential for long routes of assorted steepness, though bottom sections tend to be cobbles at low angles that require a fair amount to brushing and cleaning as is usual in the FH.
